I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was originally a novel that French film-maker Luc Moullet wrote before being adapted for the screen by journalist/director/writer Bertrand Blier. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat-loving elderly neighbor, Lucy Caroline Chandler (Katherine Forsamp), trying to rid the family of their household pets, until they ultimately discover she and her cats are not what they seem.
Starring: Alice Krige Brian Peck Ana Hodgkin Katherine Sandoz John Petroh Bret Snodgrass Ali Hillis
